info.game_comments: 2007 Teen Tournament Summer Games semifinal game 1.

(1, 1).clue: In early April 1775 William Dawes, Samuel Prescott & this man rode to warn Patriots to move military stores from Concord

(2, 1).clue: UC Berkeley's teams are known as the golden these, & there's one on the state flag

(5, 1).clue: She probably wrote about her cheerleading days at Katy High School in Texas in her own diary, not Bridget Jones's

(6, 1).clue: In the 1930s it was advertised as "the handkerchiefs you can throw away"

(1, 2).clue: 3 years after writing the Declaration of Independence, he succeeded Patrick Henry as Virginia governor

(2, 2).clue: Pepperdine's nickname is this, & some lap not too far away from the campus

(5, 2).clue: This ex-Eastern Regional High cheerleader must have let out a cheer when she became Regis Philbin's co-host

(6, 2).clue: Feline term for a pool of money to which many have contributed

(1, 3).clue: On 7/3/76 he wrote to his wife Abigail that the colonies "are, and of right ought to be, free and independent states"

(2, 3).clue: This word describing Penn State's Lions comes from an Algonquian term meaning "single mountain"

(3, 3).clue: In 2001, an anonymous buyer paid more than $6 million for a 1623 "first folio" of this English author's plays

(5, 3).clue: Mandy Moore spent years as a cheerleader before playing one in this "regal" Anne Hathaway film of 2001

(6, 3).clue: The "K" is silent in this word meaning complicated, as in a difficult problem; the word also describes ropes & trees

(1, 4).clue: In 1724, at the age of 18, he left Philadelphia for England to train as a printer; he stayed there 2 years

(2, 4).clue: The University of Texas at Arlington uses this nickname shared by the NBA team closest to them

(3, 4).clue: In 2000 a set of books about these critters "Of America" by John James Audubon sold at auction for $8.8 million

(5, 4).clue: These 2 stars of "Desperate Housewives" were high school cheerleaders(Hint: they're both brunettes)

(6, 4).clue: We may put you to sleep telling you its standard dimensions are an impressive 76 x 80 inches

(1, 5).clue: In "Public Good", this pamphleteer called for Virginia to cede land needed to form a strong central government

(2, 5).clue: This University of Idaho nickname is from an old Germanic tribe whose name has come to mean troublemakers

(3, 5).clue: The world's most valuable one of these instruments is one made by Antonio Stradivari in 1716 worth $18 million

(5, 5).clue: Two bits, four bits, six bits, a dollar.  If you know this Phillips Academy cheerleader, stand up and holler!

(6, 5).clue: The colors of Hawaii Pacific University are Columbia blue and this shade of green

(1, 1).clue: Around 400 B.C. the Greek Ctesias described it as having a white body with a straight cubit-long horn

(2, 1).clue: This 2003 "Lord of the Rings" installment has Frodo & Sam approaching Mount Doom to destroy the one ring

(3, 1).clue: Hitting a speed of about 800 miles per hour, Chuck Yeager broke this barrier in October 1947

(4, 1).clue: This U.S. commonwealth lies about 70 miles across the Mona Passage from the Dominican Republic

(5, 1).clue: Don't be embarrassed to use the Cargo Beach or Suede type of this cheek makeup

(1, 2).clue: The earliest ballads of this outlaw say that his activities took place in the South Yorkshire, not Nottinghamshire

(2, 2).clue: James Cameron also won an Oscar for editing this 1997 blockbuster

(3, 2).clue: August 1983 saw the first night launch of this reusable U.S. orbital vehicle

(4, 2).clue: Russia's Wrangel Island & Canada's Prince Patrick Island lie in this ocean

(5, 2).clue: Spanish for "mask", this cosmetic is used to color the eylashes

(1, 3).clue: This steel drivin' man beat a steam drill in a race to make a railroad tunnel but died with his "hammer in his hand"

(2, 3).clue: Jack-Jack Parr is the baby of the family of superheroes in this animated film

(3, 3).clue: Taking 16 hours, in 1919 British aviators Alcock & Brown became the first to cross this large body of water nonstop

(4, 3).clue: A chain of shoals known as Adam's Bridge stretches between India & this island nation

(3, 4).clue: In 1909 Louis Bleriot became the first person to fly a plane over this between Great Britain & France

(4, 4).clue: This large island's 2 highest peaks lie in the Maoke Mountains on the Indonesian side

(5, 4).clue: In the 1930s Max Factor introduced pan-cake, which was this makeup base

(2, 5).clue: "I see dead people" is a line from this Bruce Willis film
